p: Dried and finely ground plant material from randomly selected plants (0.5 g) was digested with ten milliliters of concentrated HNO 3 (ultrapure 65%) by incubating overnight at room temperature and heating for 4 h at 120°C. The temperature was then increased to 140°C until 1 mL of acid remained and samples were filtered after cooling. Pb and Cu concentrations were determined with atomic absorption spectrophotometry (Analyst 400 Perkin Elmer, England) ( Jackson, 1967). Results were calculated in mg Pb or Cu, respectively × kg -1 dry weight.
